posts.title: Renoir
posts.excerpt: Renoir (2012) Set on the French Riviera in the summer of 1915, Jean Renoir — son of the Impressionist painter, Pierre-Auguste — returns home to convalesce after being wounded in World War I. At his side is Andrée, a young woman who rejuvenates, enchants, and inspires both father and son.

posts._title: Michael Apted – Firstborn AKA Moving In (1984)
posts.title: Firstborn
posts.excerpt: Firstborn (1984) A teen must protect his family when his mother’s sinister new boyfriend begins exerting his authority in their home.

posts.title: Tessera Mavra Kostoumia
posts.excerpt: Tessera Mavra Kostoumia (2010)Four undertakers in financial trouble latch onto a one-off opportunity to change their lives and bid farewell to a profession they entered for a while, but got stuck in for good.On the promise of a large fee, they fulfill the dying wish of a rich Greek who lived his life abroad: he …

posts.title: Idiot
posts.excerpt: Idiot (2003) The thrilling drama based on the world’s greatest masterpiece by Fyodor Dostoevsky. Half-sane Prince Myshkin returns from Swiss psycho-clinic to face the glamorous world of St Petersburg. Here vice, money and extortion rule. Myshkin finds himself in the whirlpool of intrigue. He inherits an enormous fortune, acquires affections of the vicious Nastassya Filippovna …

posts.title: Black Venus
posts.excerpt: Black Venus (1983) Spanish actor Jose Antonio Ceinos stars as a down-and-out sculptor, whose inspiration returns with the strange appearance of a beautiful, mysterious black muse.

posts.title: Nana [+ Commentary]
posts.excerpt: Nana (1926) When the vivacious and beautiful Nana bombs at the Théâtre des Variétés, she embarks on the life of a courtesan, using her allure and charisma to entice and pleasure men.

posts._title: Danièle Huillet & Jean-Marie Straub – Die Antigone des Sophokles (1992)
posts.title: Die Antigone des Sophokles
posts.excerpt: full title: Die Antigone des Sophokles nach der Hölderlinschen Übertragung für die Bühne bearbeitet von Brecht 1948 (Suhrkamp Verlag) A teenage girl is executed for going against a king’s wishes and honoring her brother’s death.

posts.title: Yoshiwara
posts.excerpt: Yoshiwara (1937) Quote:The film is set in Yoshiwara, the red-light district of Tokyo, in the nineteenth century. It depicts a love triangle between a high-class prostitute, a Russian naval officer and a rickshaw man.

posts._title: Edith Carlmar – Bedre enn sitt rykte AKA Better Than Their Reputation (1955)
posts.title: Bedre enn sitt rykte
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘The main character Dag falls in love with his young French language teacher. It becomes a complicated love story when Dag’s class mate Karin is also fancying Dag, and Dag’s best friend, Roald, is deeply in love with Karin.’– rune-meier-1 (IMDb)

posts.title: Female Trouble
posts.excerpt: Quote:A movie like Female Trouble (1974) could be most easily classified as a comedy, but that is selling it short. “Comedy” doesn’t capture the specific satiric edge, the desperate shout, the exaggerated depravity of this film. It’s a loud, abject, offensive, and joyful declaration of self-determination and identity in the face of a world that …
